channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill 114 people, hospitals and rescuers say
item.description: Fifty-six were killed in the south when homes and tents sheltering displaced families were bombed overnight, a hospital says.

item.title: US and Iran close to nuclear deal, Trump says
item.description: Speaking in Qatar, the US President said that Iran has "sort of" agreed to the terms of a deal.

item.title: Pregnant Israeli woman killed in West Bank shooting attack
item.description: Tzeela Gez died from her injuries, but doctors were able to deliver her baby.

item.title: Construction sites appear in Gaza ahead of Israeli-US aid plan rejected by UN, images show
item.description: Satellite images show building at sites in south Gaza after US says controversial Israeli aid plan to proceed.

item.title: BBC joins Gaza children as they are evacuated to Jordan for treatment
item.description: The BBC's Fergal Keane accompanies children being evacuated from Gaza on their journey to Jordan.

item.title: Israel issues major evacuation order for Palestinians sheltering in Gaza City
item.description: Israel alleges several buildings are being used by Hamas. Local authorities and aid agencies say thousands of civilians are sheltering there.

item.title: Trump's meeting with Sharaa, unthinkable just months ago, boosts Syrians' hopes
item.description: Syria's interim leader met the US president in Riyadh after he announced he would lift sanctions on Syria.

item.title: Trump's critics and supporters unite against Qatar plane deal
item.description: The White House has doubled down on the proposed deal which has been criticised by some of the president's top supporters.

item.title: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill 80, hospitals and rescuers say
item.description: Hospitals say 29 children and 15 women were among the dead after the northern Jabalia area were hit overnight.

item.title: Human rights groups warn of 'surge' in migrant worker deaths in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Workers are already dying from preventable workplace accidents as the country prepares to host the 2034 World Cup, reports say.

item.title: Israeli air strike on hospital kills 28 people in Gaza, civil defence says
item.description: Israel's military said it was targeting a Hamas command centre which it said was beneath the hospital.

item.title: Israel denying food to Gaza is 'weapon of war', UN Palestinian refugee agency head tells BBC
item.description: Two months after all humanitarian aid was blocked, Philippe Lazzarini tells international editor Jeremy Bowen “starvation is spreading” inside Gaza.

item.title: 'I'm overjoyed to be back': Syrians face daunting rebuild after years of war
item.description: The BBC joins a convoy bringing families back to Homs, which saw some of the fiercest fighting.

item.title: Scared and malnourished - footage from Gaza shows plight of children and aftermath of Israeli strike
item.description: Israel says it targeted top Hamas militants hiding among civilians at the Khan Younis hospital.

item.title: 'I've practised being booed', Israel's Eurovision entry who survived Hamas attack tells BBC
item.description: Yuval Raphael, who survived the 7 October attack, says performing her ballad New Day Will Rise is a "personal win".

item.title: ‘Children handcuffed and shot’ – ex-UK Special Forces break silence on ‘war crimes’ by colleagues
item.description: Veterans who served with the SAS and SBS give BBC Panorama eyewitness accounts of alleged executions.

item.title: BBC team's tense encounter with sanctioned Israeli settler while filming in West Bank
item.description: Israeli settler Moshe Sharvit established a so-called 'outpost' in occupied West Bank

item.title: Americans used to be steadfast in their support for Israel. Those days are gone
item.description: To many, the close relationship between the US and Israel seems permanent and unshakeable.

item.title: Syrian security forces monitored armed civilians who killed Alawites, accused man says
item.description: One man accused of killing an Alawite during the sectarian violence in March tells the BBC that armed civilians were advised and monitored by government forces.

item.title: 'I saved my ID card and my dog': Israel expands demolitions of West Bank refugee homes
item.description: Jumaa Zawayda didn't know if his home was among those destroyed after Israel ordered thousands to evacuate Jenin.

item.title: Gaza kitchens warn food will run out in days after two months of Israeli blockade
item.description: Many Palestinians depend on community kitchens, but one says they have only two weeks of supplies left.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Netanyahu's plan for Gaza risks dividing Israel, killing Palestinians and horrifying world
item.description: The offensive to take and hold territory will sharpen everything that makes this war so controversial, writes the BBC's International Editor.

item.title: Israeli 'bunker buster' bombs used in Gaza hospital strike, experts say
item.description: CCTV footage obtained and verified by the BBC shows the moment before impact and the immediate aftermath. Munitions experts told BBC Verify that the strikes and destruction are consistent with the use of so-called "bunker buster" bombs - designed to hit underground targets. BBC Verify's Merlyn Thomas has more.

item.title: Celebrations on the streets of Syria as US sanctions lifted
item.description: Celebrations on the streets of Syria as US sanctions lifted

item.title: Deals, handshakes and Musk - Key moments in Trump's Saudi visit
item.description: US President Donald Trump has said the US has "no stronger partner" than Saudi Arabia during his first major foreign trip.

item.title: Gaza parents desperate as children face starvation under Israeli blockade
item.description: The BBC's Fergal Keane reports on the rise of malnutrition in Gaza's children.
